intro: Brachyglottis brunonis, commonly known as the Waitaha dandelion, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, yellowish-green leaves and small, dandelion-like flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in a single head. Brachyglottis brunonis is a low-growing perennial that plays a role in the ecological diversity of its native habitat.
